etymology.description: 甡(甡) (shēn, 'broom') + 又(又) (yòu, 'hand') = holding a broom made of bamboo -> broom
etymology.interpretation: This character visually combines the idea of a broom and a hand into one, symbolizing the action of holding or using a broom made from bamboo.

examples.chinese: 妈妈拿起彗(媽媽拿起彗)，扫去落叶(掃去落葉)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā ná qǐ huì, sǎo qù luòyè.
examples.english: Mama picks up the broom and sweeps away the fallen leaves.

examples.chinese: 清晨时分(清晨時分)，我用彗扫去尘埃(我用彗掃去塵埃)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén shífēn, wǒ yòng huì sǎo qù chén'āi.
examples.english: In the early morning, I sweep away the dust with the broom.
